prompt.stem: In a hydroelectric power station water flows from a reservoir through turbines at a rate of 4.5 × 106 kg per minute. The reservoir is 150 m above the turbines. The total power delivered by the water in falling from the reservoir to the turbines is

level1: Identify the relationship between power, mass flow rate and change in gravitational potential energy.
level2: Convert mass per minute to mass per second, then use P = ṁgh.

level3.content: Power from falling water: P = ṁ g h
P ≈ 1.10×10⁸ W (option C). Unit check: (kg s−1)(m s−2)(m)=kg m² s−3=W.

common_errors: Forgetting to convert kg per minute to kg s−1
Using g = 10 or omitting g entirely
